Michael,

Thanks for the prompt reply. Indeed I upgraded to 0.6.0 over the 
weekend: amazing how close a 9 looks to a 6 given enough lack of sleep

In English (to the best of my ability), what I am trying to do is use 
a separate order for each site I need to crawl. Each order hence has 
a single seed. The purpose is to place an upper bound on the number 
of "useful" bytes downloaded for each crawl order (about 100K or 1MB 
say). In other words, stop crawling the site once we have downloaded 
some number of usable bytes. I thought setting a max size limit on 
the ARC file would stop logging past that point, but I see now that 
it means a slightly different thing. I tried the number of files 
limit and while it works, I am not sure it matches my intent as some 
files may be noticably shorter than others. 

I am using a DomainScope crawl per the settings in the Profile used 
to create the Job.

Based on the information you sent me, I need to think about what 
might serve my purpose. Thanks for pointing me at the right code in 
ARCWriter. 

Seb

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Michael Stack <stack@a...> 
wrote:
> Thanks for trying Heritrix Seb.
> 
> See below.
> 
> sebastiandelachica wrote:
> 
> >I have been playing around with heritrix for a few weeks now and I 
am 
> >in the process of turning it loose on a controlled environment for 
> >one of my research strands. I am currently using version 0.9.0. My 
> >objective is to limit the amount of data scooped from a site onto 
the 
> >ARC file. I tried using the HTTP Processor max-length-bytes and 
the 
> >Archiver max-size-bytes.
> >
> >  
> >
> Do you mean 0.4.0. You say 0.9.0 above.  We just released 0.6.0 on 
> friday.  Try it if you haven't already.  Lots of fixes and 
improvements.
> 
> If you're doing a broad crawl, you have the following options 
available 
> to you:
> 
> max-bytes-download
> max-document-download
> 
> These options are not available in a domain scoped crawl which 
seems to 
> be what it is you'd like to do.
> 
> Tell us more about what it is that you'd like.
> 
> The max-length-bytes options limits size of a particular download 
only.  
> The max-size-bytes  is upper-bound on the size of ARC files written 
(See 
> the code here http://crawler.archive.org/xref/index.html).
> 
> Yours,
> St.Ack
> 
> >The Processor max-length-bytes seems to work at some level as the 
> >requests are reported as length-truncated in the logs, but the 
actual 
> >HTML files still make it into the archive.
> >
> >The Archive max-size-bytes appears to be ignored. Looking at the 
> >code, it does not seem to be used by the ARCWriterProcessor class 
or 
> >any other class for that matter...I just starting digging through 
the 
> >code earlier today.
> >
> >I continue my experimentation and code reading, but figured, I'd
